section.title: &THIS.PLATFORM; Validator
section.para: Validator is one of Stacks features. The primary purpose of the Validator is to detect malformed messages, such as an Answer message which contains a Destination-Host Attribute Value Pair (AVP).
The Validator is capable of validating multi-leveled, grouped AVPs, excluding the following content types:
That is, it is capable of checking structural integrity, not content.

listitem.para: check if AVP is in correct place, ie. Session-Id must always be encoded before any other AVP .
check if AVP occurs proper number of times

section.para: Validator is called by stack implementation. It is invoked after message is received and before it is dispatched to remote peer. Note that later means that if peer does not exist in local peer table validator is not called, as stack fails before calling it.
